1.text: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider well who is before thee;

2.text: and put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.

3.text: Be not desirous of his dainties; for they are deceitful food.

4.text: Weary not thyself to become rich; cease from thine own intelligence:

5.text: wilt thou set thine eyes upon it, it is gone; for indeed it maketh itself wings and it flieth away as an eagle towards the heavens.

6.text: Eat thou not the food of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainties.

7.text: For as he thinketh in his soul, so is he. Eat and drink! will he say unto thee; but his heart is not with thee.

8.text: Thy morsel which thou hast eaten must thou vomit up, and thou wilt have wasted thy sweet words.

9.text: Speak not in the ears of a foolish [man], for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.

10.text: Remove not the ancient landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:

11.text: for their redeemer is mighty; he will plead their cause against thee.

12.text: Apply thy heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

13.text: Withhold not correction from the child; for [if] thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die:

14.text: thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from Sheol.

15.text: My son, if thy heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine;

16.text: and my reins shall exult, when thy lips speak right things.

17.text: Let not thy heart envy sinners, but [be thou] in the fear of Jehovah all the day;

18.text: for surely there is a result, and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

19.text: Thou, my son, hear and be wise, and direct thy heart in the way.

20.text: Be not among winebibbers, among riotous eaters of flesh.

21.text: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty; and drowsiness clotheth with rags.

22.text: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

23.text: Buy the truth, and sell it not; wisdom, and instruction, and intelligence.

24.text: The father of a righteous [man] shall greatly rejoice, and he that begetteth a wise [son] shall have joy of him:

25.text: let thy father and thy mother have joy, and let her that bore thee rejoice.

26.text: My son, give me thy heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.

27.text: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.

28.text: She also lieth in wait as a robber, and increaseth the treacherous among men.

29.text: Who hath woe? Who hath sorrow? Who contentions? Who complaining? Who wounds without cause? Who redness of eyes?

30.text: —They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to try mixed wine.

31.text: Look not upon the wine when it is red, when it sparkleth in the cup, and goeth down smoothly:

32.text: at the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.

33.text: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thy heart shall speak froward things;

34.text: and thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, and as he that lieth down upon the top of a mast:

35.text: —‘’They have smitten me, [and] I am not sore; they have beaten me, [and] I knew it not. When shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.’’
